intro: Hedyotis acerosa var. potosina, commonly known as the Potosí knotweed, is a perennial herb native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is adapted to grow in rocky or disturbed soils. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
